conclusion: The problem involves determining the output power and total power of a power source when it is connected to a small light bulb.

The graph shows two lines: a straight line representing the power source's U-I relationship (line A) and a curved line representing the light bulb's U-I relationship (curve B). The intersection point of these lines is at (2 V, 2 A).
The operating point is identified as the intersection of the power source's U-I line and the light bulb's U-I curve, which is at 2 V and 2 A.
The output power of the power source is calculated as \( P_{\text{out}} = U \times I = 2 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 4 \, \text{W} \).
The total power of the power source is the same as the output power because the power source is delivering power to the light bulb, so \( P_{\text{total}} = 4 \, \text{W} \).
The output power and the total power of the power source are both 4 W.
